statements.name: PROC GRADAR
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the plot variables. Specifies an output catalog (optional).

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to add annotate elements to all graphs that are produced by the GRADAR procedure.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variable or variables to chart. By default, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output produced by the GRADAR procedure.

statements.name: CHART
statements.description: Creates the radar charts in which the length of the vertices along the spines represent the values of the chart statistic for the data categories.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to be charted. The values of the chart variable determine the spokes in the corresponding radar chart. These values are the observations in the input data set for the chart variable. You must have at least three observations in the data set as it takes three points to define a plane. Technically, you can create a GRADAR chart with only one or two observations, but a true radar chart is not displayed.

arguments.name: ACROSSVAR=
arguments.description: generates a radar chart for each value (including missing values) of the specified variable and displays the charts from left-to-right across the output area.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to add annotate elements to charts produced by the CHART statement.

arguments.name: CALENDAR
arguments.description: produces a chart displaying 12 equal-sized segments, one for each month of the year January through December.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the chart frame and the spokes or grid lines of the chart.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: fills the area inside the frame or the individual tiles with the specified color.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: specifies the color for filling the area for the row labels displayed along the left side of a chart.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: specifies the color for filling the area for the column labels that are displayed across the top of a chart.

arguments.name: CSPOKES=
arguments.description: specifies a color to use for the spokes in a chart.

arguments.name: CSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: specifies a color or list of colors for the circles that are requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: CSTARFILL=
arguments.description: specifies a color or colors for filling the interior of stars when STARFILL= is set to SOLID.

arguments.name: CSTARS=
arguments.description: specifies a color or list of colors for the outlines of stars.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the chart.

arguments.name: CTILES=
arguments.description: specifies one or more colors for the tiles.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DOWNVAR=
arguments.description: generates a radar chart for each value of the specified variable, and displays the charts from top-to-bottom.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for all text strings in the radar chart.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies whether a frame is drawn around the chart.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies whether a frame is drawn around the chart.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height in cells for labels and legends.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: IFRAME=
arguments.description: specifies an image file to display inside the chart's frame.

arguments.name: IMAGESTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies how to display the image file that is specified on the IFRAME= option.

arguments.name: INBORDER
arguments.description: generates an inside border around the chart.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height for spoke labels.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: specifies the distance (in cells) between tiles in a chart.

arguments.name: LSPOKES=
arguments.description: specifies a line type for the spokes in a radar chart.

arguments.name: LSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: specifies one or more line types for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

arguments.name: LSTARS=
arguments.description: specifies the line types for the outlines of stars that are produced for a radar chart.

arguments.name: MAXNVERT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of vertices, from 1 to 360, in the radar chart.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: MODE=
arguments.description: specifies the display mode for a radar chart.

arguments.name: SHARE
arguments.description: shares the drawing space between the text and the graph.

arguments.name: PROTECT
arguments.description: shares the drawing space but maintains a solid rectangle (using the background color) behind the text. This is useful when the text is illegible because of the image specified with the IFRAME= option or the color specified with the CFRAME= option.

arguments.name: RESERVE
arguments.description: reduces the size of the text and graph in order to accommodate both.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in a chart.

arguments.name: NLEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of colors used in the calendar chart to represent the magnitude of the frequency variable.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is otherwise automatically displayed.

arguments.name: NOZEROREF
arguments.description: turns off the zero reference circle when negative values are plotted.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in a chart.

arguments.name: OTHER=
arguments.description: specifies a new category that merges all categories not selected because of the MAXNVERT= option.

arguments.name: OVERLAYVAR=
arguments.description: creates a comparative radar chart using the levels of the overlay variable.

arguments.name: SPEED=
arguments.description: specifies the wind speed in wind rose charts.

arguments.name: SPIDERWEB
arguments.description: displays lines connecting the points where tick marks would be instead of displaying the tick marks.

arguments.name: SPKLABEL=
arguments.description: labels the chart spokes with the category of the variable that is being charted.

arguments.name: SPOKESCALE=
arguments.description: specifies whether every spoke is drawn to the same scale, or whether each spoke is drawn to a different scale.

arguments.name: STARAXIS=
arguments.description: assigns one or more axis definitions to the axis spokes in the radar chart.

arguments.name: STARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: specifies reference circles that are superimposed on the stars that are produced for a radar chart.

arguments.name: STARFILL=
arguments.description: determines whether the stars in the radar chart are empty or filled with a solid color.
arguments.help: STARFILL= lists of SOLID | EMPTY, one for each star

arguments.name: STARINRADIUS=
arguments.description: specifies the inner radius of stars as a percent from 0 to 100.

arguments.name: STARLEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the style of the legend used to identify the vertices of stars that are produced for a radar chart.

arguments.name: CLOCK
arguments.description: identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 12:00).

arguments.name: CLOCK0
arguments.description: identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 0:00 corresponding to 12:00).

arguments.name: NUMBER
arguments.description: identifies the vertex variables by numbers. The number 1 corresponds to 12 o'clock. Legend entries are assigned in clockwise order.

arguments.name: DEGREES
arguments.description: identifies the vertex variables by angles in degrees. Zero degrees corresponds to 12 o'clock.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the legend. This is the default.

arguments.name: STARLEGENDLAB=
arguments.description: specifies the label displayed to the left of the legend for stars requested with the STARLEGEND= option.

arguments.name: STAROUTRADIUS=
arguments.description: specifies the outer radius of stars as a percent up to 100.

arguments.name: STARSTART=
arguments.description: specifies the vertex angle for the first variable that is specified in the CHART statement.

arguments.name: STARTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the style of the stars that are produced for a radar chart.

arguments.name: CORONA
arguments.description: polygon with star-vertices emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: POLYGON
arguments.description: closed polygon

arguments.name: RADIAL
arguments.description: rays emanating from the center

arguments.name: SPOKE
arguments.description: rays emanating from the inner circle

arguments.name: WEDGE
arguments.description: closed polygon with rays from the center to the full spoke length.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable to be used to construct weighted radar charts.

arguments.name: TILELEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies a variable used to add a legend for CTILES= colors.

arguments.name: TILELEGLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label displayed to the left of the legend that is created when you specify a TILELEGEND= variable.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: See WFRAME=.

arguments.name: WFRAME=
arguments.description: specifies the width in pixels for the frame lines.

arguments.name: WINDROSE
arguments.description: specifies a wind rose chart.

arguments.name: WINDROSECIRCLES=
arguments.description: specifies the number of reference circles.

arguments.name: WSPOKES=
arguments.description: specifies the width in pixels of the spokes in a radar chart.

arguments.name: WSTARCIRCLES=
arguments.description: specifies the width in pixels of the outline of circles requested by the STARCIRCLES= and WINDROSECIRCLES= options.

arguments.name: WSTARS=
arguments.description: specifies the width in pixels of the outline of stars that are produced for a radar chart.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

arguments.name: ALT=
arguments.description: specifies descriptive text for a URL to which a note links, or the note itself.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the baseline of the entire text string with respect to the horizontal.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of a box produced by the BOX= option.

arguments.name: BLANK=
arguments.description: protects the box and its contents from being overwritten by any subsequent graphics elements.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: draws a box around one line of text.

arguments.name: BSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between the boxed text and the box.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the following text, box, or line.

arguments.name: DRAW=
arguments.description: draws lines anywhere on the graphics output area.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the subsequent text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of text characters in number of units.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: LANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the entire text-string(s).

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies a uniform resource locator (URL) to which a note links.

arguments.name: LSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing above and below lines of text.

arguments.name: MOVE=
arguments.description: positions a text string.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated.

arguments.name: UNDERLIN=
arguments.description: underlines subsequent text.

arguments.name: WRAP
arguments.description: wraps the text to a second line if the text does not fit on one line.

arguments.name: #BYLINE
arguments.description: substitutes the entire BY line without leading or trailing blanks for #BYLINE in the text string. It also displays the BY line in the note produced by the statement.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.
